definitions.definition: the act of making something known or public that was previously secret or private

examples.text: the newspaper’s disclosure of defence secrets
The bank will need full disclosure of your financial situation and assets.
The court ruled to prevent public disclosure of the contents of the documents.

definitions.definition: information or a fact that is made known or public that was previously secret or private

examples.text: startling disclosures about his private life

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from disclose, on the pattern of closure.
